LATEST: üìä US spot XRP ETFs recorded their first outflows since their November launch on Wednesday, with $40.8 million exiting and ending a 36-day streak of continuous net inflows into the funds.

On January 7, U.S. spot #XRP ETFs reported net outflows of $40.7 million, interrupting a 6- to 7-week inflow streak that had topped $1.2 billion. This decline mirrors a broader risk-off trend in crypto ETFs, with Bitcoin and Ethereum funds also experiencing redemptions. Most of the outflows were attributed to one fund, 21Shares, while others remained stable or saw slight inflows, indicating a rotation rather than a mass exit. Meanwhile, the price of $XRP corrected approximately 6.90%, dropping to $2.08 after a strong weekly rally‚Äîa typical retracement following significant gains. $XRP   fell to $2.12 on the morning of January 9, 2026, and the market held its breath in the short term. A rare two-way liquidation chain on the Binance futures side cleared leveraged positions on both the upside and downside. As a result, the spot price was stuck in the $2.07 to $2.17 range. The search for direction prevailed until a new catalyst arrived. Two-Way Liquidation Locks XRP in a Narrow Band  In the last 24 hours, XRP has fallen 2.3%, dropping from $2.17 to $2.12. On January 5th, when the price approached $2.40, approximately 4.4 million dollars worth of short positions were liquidated. The next day, the direction reversed, with a total of $5.5 million worth of long positions liquidated. A wait-and-see approach of approximately 1 million dollars also emerged on the Binance side.  The symmetrical liquidation sequence indicated indecision rather than a clear trend. Excessive leverage was removed, and tail risk decreased. However, the market punished both sides. The trading flow became technical. The short-term narrative was determined by leverage resets, not fundamental dynamics. The 2.07 Support and 2.17 Resistance levels became clearly defined on the chart.  The clearest signal came from the demand pocket between $2.07 and $2.08. At 2 PM on January 8th, volume jumped to 154.85 million XRP. This figure was 93% above the 24-hour average of 66.4 million. When the price dropped to the lower band, buyers absorbed the selling pressure, and a V-shaped reaction occurred.  This reaction carried XRP from $2.09 to $2.16 between 3 PM and 5 PM, but the rise stalled again near $2.17.
